intro: Centaurea ochrolopha, commonly known as the yellow centaurea, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and features bright yellow flowers with dark central cones. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Centaurea ochrolopha is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky slopes and grasslands.
